title: The Most Favorite Champion of All Time [Voting Elimination] - Group M
body:
First of all, last Group Winners are: **Lux** (208 votes) and **Diana** (135 votes). Lux just one shotted other heroes, only Diana made it in time to click that Zhonya. Lets go to Group M. **LET THE BEST WIN**.

Also please check out my [YouTube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMVxkqVcf2KPo8dYfRcchJA) and come sometimes chill to my [Twitch Channel](https://www.twitch.tv/razyelxgaming), I am streaming almost daily.

Thanks for every support!:)

**BASIC INFO:**

Hello,

who is your favorite champion? And who is the most favorite champion of all 137 champions? Let´s find out! I´ve created a bracked of all champions currently in the game. It will be up to you guys to decide who is the BEST champion. 

The **voting will last for 2 days**, then **2 champions with the most votes will make it to next round** and I will create another voting thread for Group N and so on, until there is only 1 winner.

The full Bracked can be found on my [FaceBook](https://www.facebook.com/RazyeLx) / [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RazyeLxGaming) or down below on the next link:

[http://imgur.com/HCtY8F9](http://imgur.com/HCtY8F9)

So lets get to it. Here are the 8 champions. Vote for your most favorite. Only 2 will make it to next round!:) You don´t have your favorite here? Then vote for the one you like the most:)

If you have any questions, just ask:)

PS: Only votes on this thread count. I won´t count any comments/votes on other pages, forums, etc.
PSS: I use this Board, bcs I can´t post to General discussion, its bugged.
PSSS: You can find results of:
- Group A [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/PizTEHPg-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-a)
- Group B [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/qAj5uFam-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-b)
- Group C [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/BsWOFBMZ-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-c)
- Group D [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/JnLEbNX9-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-d)
- Group E [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/as4Kgdq0-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-e)
- Group F [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/crhoY6m7-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-f)
- Group G [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/ALeEXAGa-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-g)
- Group H [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/xJgs9cyW-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-h)
- Group I [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/A9MVvYy5-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-i)
- Group J [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/Ni7k1P8y-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-j)
- Group K [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/EbBOaZe3-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-k)
- Group L [HERE](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/3PEpPwR8-the-most-favorite-champion-of-all-time-voting-elimination-group-l)

RazyeLx

replies.body:
{{champion:245}} 's design is probably one of the best.
{{champion:103}} has a super nice background and thematic now
and {{champion:201}} {{champion:83}} are real daddies.. Still don't know who to chose..:(

Just remember this exists and you should be good.

https://youtu.be/zYd8D804bT0

https://youtu.be/oNk6-0rDdto


Also if you're pulling for braum
I had to chose Yorick, because the poor monk needs bread and water and some occasional love too.

I'm sure you mean everything but Ekkos gameplay design. I agree with you then.

Some of his kit is cool but the design...
Care to elaborate?

Sure thing.

I have a few problems with him:

- There is too much counterplay. Or rather there is too much you need to counter to survive. You gotta watch for his W's, dodge his Q _both_ ways, make sure he can't easily all in you with his E, account for his ult's heal so you don't all in too hard, account for his ults dash, account for his ult's big AoE nuke, AND manage how many passive procs he has on you. Then theres the rest of the game such as ganks and farming you gotta keep in mind. 

- I feel like my playstyle is more effected because he picked Ekko then the champion I picked. 

- His ultimate has a very similar problem to Mercy's current ultimate in overwatch. I feel that even if I do catch out Ekko or get a pick on him he will be able to escape so many situations he shouldn't because of his ultimate. 

- Tons of crowd control on an assassin.

- Maxing E gives him some very reliable damage.

- His Q and E combo isn't actually all too fair.

> - There is too much counterplay. Or rather there is too much you need to counter to survive. 

You mean being zoned?

>You gotta watch for his W's

Easiest to dodge skillshot in the game

>dodge his Q _both_ ways

Short range Q, second part gives you 3-4 seconds to move either slightly to the left or right... or just back up.

> make sure he can't easily all in you with his E

Only way this happens is if youre squishy and heavily out of position or lack reliable burst 

>account for his ult's heal so you don't all in too hard

Ignite, Ekko also has to account for how much he will heal

>account for his ults dash

Also critical for a good ekko, otherwise you will ult yourself into your own death

>account for his ult's big AoE nuke

Second most telegraphed ability in the game. If you ever stand on it, unless baiting with zhonyas, you deserve to die period.

> manage how many passive procs he has on you

He isn't braum. It's the same as Gnar or Vayne, except easier to avoid than either

> Then theres the rest of the game such as ganks and farming you gotta keep in mind

He's an exceptional ganker. His laning is weak and made up for with both experience and hard shoving. Ekko wants you under your tower so he can snowball off your bot.

> - I feel like my playstyle is more effected because he picked Ekko then the champion I picked. 

This makes no sense. You should always be altering your playstyle based on your opponent. If you go melee into Malzahar you have to play a passive lane. If you go teemo into pantheon you have to die. That's just the game. If you feel Ekko punishes you more for not adapting, it's because Ekko is one of your tilt champions.

>  I feel that even if I do catch out Ekko or get a pick on him he will be able to escape so many situations he shouldn't because of his ultimate.

He is a slippery assassin. If he is using his ultimate defensively that's a safer teamfight you should be forcing.  No risk of being bursted by the ult for being out of position, higher chance of killing him if you land your burst.
 
> - Tons of crowd control on an assassin.

He has two forms of CC, a ranged slow and a situational stun he should never land on you. If you're having that hard of a time dodging the W maybe you should buy some boots.

> - Maxing E gives him some very reliable damage.

You've never played Ekko in your life. Not well anyway.

> - His Q and E combo isn't actually all too fair.

"If I lose its not fair" reminder Ekko has to use his waveclear ability, dash, and assloads of mana early to hit that combo.


Your criticisms seem to have more to do with your "feelings" than with any actual numbers or facts.

See you missed the point. Dodging Ekko W isn't necessarily difficult, even when he does it usually from stealth where you can't see it, and managing his passive stacks isn't too hard. However **he forces the enemy to keep track of too much**. Its ridiculous. 

But I'll take away your bias arguments anyways. 

> You mean being zoned?

Well Ekko does zone me. But I mean he has like 40 different things I need to keep track of if I want to live. See I'd rather be playing my character rather than "against Ekko". 

> Easiest to dodge skillshot in the game

Its fucking massive and if he does it from stealth you won't see it coming. In fact the projectile speed is pretty good its just the delay that makes it difficult to land while they can see you. Yes I know you can ward up to prevent this, its just ANOTHER thing you have to manage when fighting Ekko. 

> Short range Q, second part gives you 3-4 seconds to move either slightly to the left or right... or just back up.

If you back up you will just get hit by the second pull back because he gets some very potent slows on his Q. Up to 60%. And again my point went totally over your head. Its not that its too difficult to dodge his Q both ways, its just yet ANOTHER thing I have to take care of when fighting him.

> Only way this happens is if youre squishy and heavily out of position or lack reliable burst

Unfortunately the vast majority of mid laners are squishy, a very large group of them lack reliable burst, and you would consider heavily out of position anywhere out of my 1/3 of the lane. 

> Ignite, Ekko also has to account for how much he will heal

See the fact your telling me to use ignite in order to mitigate his healing brings up ANOTHER thing you'll need to remember when fighting Ekko. 

Ekko does not. He can tell he will get a big chunk but he doesn't need to do anything of the things his enemies do. If I'm fighting Ekko I need to account for how much he will heal so I know if I can kill him afterwards, if he will be able to reengage and kill me, if my ally can kill him alone still, etc. 

> Also critical for a good ekko, otherwise you will ult yourself into your own death

Once more you completely missed the point. I never said his dash is easy to use or broken. I said its _yet another thing to manage when fighting Ekko._ 

> Second most telegraphed ability in the game. If you ever stand on it, unless baiting with zhonyas, you deserve to die period.

For how easy an Ekko ult can be to land (not that it is easy but its no Shurima Shuffle) I do not think it should be a guaranteed kill. Its already a massive heal and dash with untargetability, why does he need free kills for when he lands on an enemy too? 

And again. I'm not here to talk about how fair you think Ekko is balance wise. He is extremely poor design wise. 

> He isn't braum. It's the same as Gnar or Vayne, except easier to avoid than either

If I have two stacks of his passive on me in lane I have to walk away from the wave so he doesn't pop the third one. Flat out something I have to manage and play around. 

> He's an exceptional ganker. His laning is weak and made up for with both experience and hard shoving. Ekko wants you under your tower so he can snowball off your bot.

His laning is not weak. He might be a mid game assassin or something, but he has a _very safe_ early game. Between your Q allowing mindless wave clear, your shields, your Q+E>sprint away combo, your dash, and your ult which gives incredible safety, Ekko's laning is not weak. 

I'm not saying that Ekko doesn't get stronger as he gets items, or that he doesn't have low kill pressure in lane. But his lane is very safe and relaxed. 

> This makes no sense. You should always be altering your playstyle based on your opponent. If you go melee into Malzahar you have to play a passive lane. If you go teemo into pantheon you have to die. That's just the game. If you feel Ekko punishes you more for not adapting, it's because Ekko is one of your tilt champions.

Funny how you compare Ekko to Malzahar, Pantheon, and even teemo. All champions people currently hate or hated very much. 

You are right, I should alternate my playstyle based on my champion. However when it gets to the point that my playstyle is more so effected because you picked Ekko then it is based off my character, its overboard. Ekko forces the enemy to play his game. 

And Pantheon being a "your going to die" lane is **Not ** okay. Tons of players hate this about him and its a big reasons he is in line for a rework some time in the future. 

> He is a slippery assassin. If he is using his ultimate defensively that's a safer teamfight you should be forcing. No risk of being bursted by the ult for being out of position, higher chance of killing him if you land your burst.

Your sort of right. He does lose out a significant amount if he burns ult. However few things in League are as dreadful as _finally_ catching out that Ekko who is already a slippery assassin with potent CC and shields, only for him to ult away. Ekko survives situations he screwed up royally in and should die, even for a slippery assassins. 

> You've never played Ekko in your life. Not well anyway.

Prove this. Because I have played Ekko and I have done well with him. 

> "If I lose its not fair" reminder Ekko has to use his waveclear ability, dash, and assloads of mana early to hit that combo.

> Your criticisms seem to have more to do with your "feelings" than with any actual numbers or facts.

His Q has a very low cooldown. He doesn't have much down time if he uses it to burst you. _And just like any other mana user, Ekko should have to pay for his spells._

His Q E combo is not fair for the enemy even if its "costly" for Ekko.

I'm not bringing up facts as in numbers because I'm not worried about Ekko's winrate/playrate/banrate/builds/etc. 

I did however bring up facts. I listed out all of the things Ekko's force you to play around. Compare him to a champion like Xerath.

You must watch for the stun which isn't meaningful up close, deny him bonus mana from his passive, side step Q's, and be careful for when your low and he has his ultimate. You could include dodging his W but if he lands his stun your probably not going to be dodging his W .
Ekko's design is the most overloaded and unbalanced. There is no question about that.

Design doesn't equal champion abilities.
It is mostly about character, visuals and background story, which is the reason why I would chose Ekko.
When you talk about design on the Boards, it usually refers to the champion's kit. Just a heads up then.

Alright, the voting is now **CLOSED** with total of 668 votes. The winners of Group M are: {{champion:245}} Ekko with 148 votes and {{champion:103}}  Ahri with 142 votes. I will now update the bracket and create Group N. Be right Back.
